member.name: OBJECT_TYPE_LIST
member.summary: The OBJECT_TYPE_LIST structure identifies an object type element in a hierarchy of object types. The functions use an array of OBJECT_TYPE_LIST structures to define a hierarchy of an object and its subobjects, such as property sets and properties.

summary.para: Specifies the level of the object type in the hierarchy of an object and its subobjects. Level zero indicates the object itself. Level one indicates a subobject of the object, such as a property set. Level two indicates a subobject of the level one subobject, such as a property. There can be a maximum of five levels numbered zero through four.
Directory service objects use the following level values.

listheader.description: Indicates the object itself at level zero.
Indicates a property set at level one.
Indicates a property at level two.

member.name: OBJECT_TYPE_LIST.Sbz
member.summary: Should be zero. Reserved for future use.

member.name: OBJECT_TYPE_LIST.ObjectType
member.summary: A pointer to the GUID for the object or subobject.
